page.title: 11GAMEKEEPING, RIDDLESWORTH
page.content: The present gamekeeper has been at the Riddlesworth estate for the past 33 years having followed in his father's footsteps. He works non-stop through- out the week. The estate has 2000 acres of oak, ash, beech, lime, birch, sycamore, chestnut and fir trees. There are a few roe and red deer as well as stoats, weasles and foxes. The rabbits all have mixamatosis. The gamekeeper rears pheasants and partridges from one day old. They are fed on wheat. 1800 to 1900 birds are freed each year. Shooters from all over the country are invited to shoot here. The shooting season starts on 1 September for partridges and l October for pheasants lasting until l February. Most of the birds are shot each year. There are quite a few poachers on the estate, some of whom are caught.
